tech_news.title: Destiny 2 Renegades launch trailer leaks early via YouTube ad ahead of developer livestream - The Game Post
tech_news.description: A new Destiny 2 Renegades launch trailer leak has appeared via a YouTube ad, giving us our first look at new story cinematics, characters, and Star Wars-style ships ahead of Bungie’s developer livestream.

tech_news.title: HP and Dell disable HEVC support built into their laptops’ CPUs - Ars Technica
tech_news.description: HEVC licensing gets more expensive in January.

tech_news.title: Google Launches Unauthorized Pixel-to-iPhone File Sharing With Apple’s AirDrop - Bloomberg.com
tech_news.description: Alphabet Inc.’s Google said it has developed a way for its latest Pixel smartphones to exchange images and other files with iPhones using Apple Inc.’s AirDrop protocol, a bold attempt to undermine the exclusivity of its rival’s closely guarded ecosystem.

tech_news.title: Apple shows how much faster the M5 runs local LLMs compared to the M4 - 9to5Mac
tech_news.description: A new post on Apple’s Machine Learning Research blog shows how much the M5 improved over the M4 when it comes to running a local LLM.

tech_news.title: Borderlands 4's First DLC Is Now Free And Out For Everyone - Kotaku
tech_news.description: Bounty Pack 1: How Rush Saved Mercenary Day is out now on all platforms and adds a new questline, guns, and cosmetics

tech_news.title: Microsoft makes Zork I II , and III open source under MIT License - Ars Technica
tech_news.description: Microsoft’s Open Source Programs Office worked with Jason Scott to do it.

tech_news.title: Open-World RPG Where Winds Meet Has It All: Evil Geese, AI Chatbots, And A $40,000 Skin - Kotaku
tech_news.description: The wildly popular Wuxia game jams a lot into its world, to varying degrees of success

tech_news.title: In Time for the Holidays, Apple (AAPL) Launches the ‘iPhone Pocket’ - TipRanks
tech_news.description: The knitted strap comes with an expensive price tag.

tech_news.title: Zoopunk Was Used To Demonstrate Generative AI Assets - Kotaku
tech_news.description: Zoopunk was part of today's Xbox Partner Preview showcase

tech_news.title: Mixup is a new, Mad Libs-style app for creating AI images from photos, text, and doodles - TechCrunch
tech_news.description: The new app lets anyone use Google's Nano Banana in a fun new way, with fill-in-the-blank AI "recipes" that users can share.
